title: Marauder's Map
data:
| ?   Marauder's Map   [![Scroll.png](/images/8/8d/Scroll.png)](/wiki/File:Scroll.png) |                                                                                                                                       |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                                                                            | [scroll of magic mapping](/wiki/Scroll_of_magic_mapping "Scroll of magic mapping")                                                    |
|                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                       |
| Affiliation                                                                          | - [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")
- [(Pirate)](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate")                                                              |
|                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                       |
| When carried                                                                         | *(none)*                                                                                                                              |
| When read                                                                            | [clairvoyance](/wiki/Clairvoyance "Clairvoyance")                                                                                     |
| When invoked                                                                         | * [object detection](/wiki/Potion_of_object_detection "Potion of object detection")
* [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") detection |
|                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                       |
| Base price                                                                           | 2000 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                                                                                    |
| Weight                                                                               | [10](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                                                                           |

The **Marauder's Map** is the first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for the [Pirate](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") role, incorporated into [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"). It is also the only [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") that Pirates can receive as a sacrifice gift.

The map is unusual among artifacts in that its base item is a [scroll of magic mapping](/wiki/Scroll_of_magic_mapping "Scroll of magic mapping"), which is normally single-use. Reading this scroll does not destroy it. To compensate, however, reading the map only reveals the surroundings of the user (as by [clairvoyance](/wiki/Clairvoyance "Clairvoyance")), instead of complete [magic mapping](/wiki/Scroll_of_magic_mapping "Scroll of magic mapping").

When #[invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke"), the Map first [detects all objects](/wiki/Potion_of_object_detection "Potion of object detection") on the level, then detects [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact"). The second check partially compensates for Pirates' inability to receive sacrifice gifts other than the Map. Because their deity won't give them additional artifacts, Pirates can only wish for artifacts or find them while exploring. The Map's invocation effect provides a way to check a level for generated artifacts the Pirate may have missed.

The Marauder's Map is [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") for [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") and [wishing](/wiki/Wish "Wish") purposes.

## Mythology

The Marauder's Map is inspired by the [object of the same name](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magical_objects_in_Harry_Potter#The_Marauder.27s_Map "wikipedia:Magical objects in Harry Potter") from the *[Harry Potter](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Potter "wikipedia:Harry Potter")* series by J. K. Rowling: a map which Harry receives from Fred and George Weasley in *Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban*. At first sight, the map appears to be a blank parchment, but when activated by a special incantation the parchment becomes a map of Hogwarts School, which reveals not only many of the school's secret rooms and passageways, but also the presence and identity of people within the school, whose names appear on the map at their exact location.

## References

Reference: [Chris's Pirate Patch](https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/NetHack/compare/master...Chris_s_Pirate_Patch.diff)

Marauder's Map

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
?   Marauder's Map  
Base item scroll of magic mapping
Affiliation
  • chaotic
  • (Pirate)
When carried (none)
When read clairvoyance
When invoked
  • object detection
  • artifact detection
Base price 2000 zm
Weight 10

The Marauder's Map is the first sacrifice gift for the Pirate role, incorporated into dNetHack, SlashTHEM and SpliceHack. It is also the only artifact that Pirates can receive as a sacrifice gift.

The map is unusual among artifacts in that its base item is a scroll of magic mapping, which is normally single-use. Reading this scroll does not destroy it. To compensate, however, reading the map only reveals the surroundings of the user (as by clairvoyance), instead of complete magic mapping.

When #invoked, the Map first detects all objects on the level, then detects artifacts. The second check partially compensates for Pirates' inability to receive sacrifice gifts other than the Map. Because their deity won't give them additional artifacts, Pirates can only wish for artifacts or find them while exploring. The Map's invocation effect provides a way to check a level for generated artifacts the Pirate may have missed.

The Marauder's Map is chaotic for bones and wishing purposes.

Mythology

The Marauder's Map is inspired by the object of the same name from the Harry Potter series by J. K. Rowling: a map which Harry receives from Fred and George Weasley in Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban. At first sight, the map appears to be a blank parchment, but when activated by a special incantation the parchment becomes a map of Hogwarts School, which reveals not only many of the school's secret rooms and passageways, but also the presence and identity of people within the school, whose names appear on the map at their exact location.

References

Reference: Chris's Pirate Patch
